snippet.title: Weirdest beliefs of Hollywood stars
snippet.content:
WE all love to speculate the existance of the supernatural and hey, while some of us believe we've seen a ghost or a UFO - thankfully we don't all have a worldwide platform we can share such wacky theories. While singer Kesha believes she has sex with ghosts, Kanye West doesn't just believe in God - he believes he IS God. Click through the gallery below for an insight into the most out there theories in Hollywood:
Weirdest beliefs of Hollywood stars
Singer Kesha says she has sex with ghosts. "I've got a song called 'Supernatural', that song was about having sex with a ghost," she told Ryan Seacrest. "I lived in this flop house at Rural Canyon and there was this weird energy that lived there, and it used to keep me [up] at night and wake me up. And it progressed into this dark, sexual spirit." Picture: Getty Images
"I am a god," West sings on his new album. "I wrote 'I Am a God'... Cause it's like, 'Yo! Nobody can tell me where I can and can't go'," he told W Magazine. "Man, I'm the number living and breathing rock star. I am Axl Rose; I am Jim Morrison; I am Jimi Hendrix." Tell us how you really feel, Kanye. Picture: Getty Images
Kylie Jenner is another celebrity that believes in the chemtrails conspiracy theory. The 17-year-old shared her thoughts in a picture posted to her Twitter account. Picture: Getty Images; Twitter
Dean Cain didn't believe in Bigfoot before he started filming the upcoming reality show "10 Million Dollar Bigfoot Bounty," but now his views have changed. "Since I've already shot the show, I can't say definitively whether I believe there's a Sasquatch, Bigfoot, Yeti out there," Cain said on "Fox Friends. Picture: Getty Images
The country singer told Us Weekly that she has a "very irrational fear of spiders. And alien abductions." Musgraves also claimed she's seen "several UFOs." Picture: Getty Images
Tom Delonge (left) from US band Blink-182 believes he had an encounter with an alien while filming near Area 51. He opened up to Paper magazine claiming the government once tapped his phone to find out about the information he had gathered on extraterrestrials.
Actor Rob Lowe claims to be able to speak with dead people. "There's a device they use that the theory is it can translate.. that the spirits can talk through this device, for a lack of a better term.. I don't want to seem like a nut. I don't want to end my career here." Picture: Getty Images
Pop star Lady Gaga once said she tries to refrain from having sex because she believes her partners will try and take "my creativity from me through my vagina." Picture: Getty Images
Rocker Pete Doherty has been quoted saying the west wing of his home is haunted. He claims the area, which used to be the servants quarters of the house, will become lively as if ghosts are having a "mad party." Picture: Getty Images
Angelina Jolie was once known for wearing a vial of blood around her neck, belonging to her then-husband Billy Bob Thorton. Not to worry, Thorton sported a vial of Jolie's blood around his neck too. It is rumored the two believed the vials strengthened their bond. Picture: Getty Images This article was reproduced with permission from . Originally published as
